attributes.action: Make a fair, set amount of maintenance per child and not 25% of income!
attributes.background: Non resident parents (NRP's) are paying far too much to the resident parent of their child/children. This is causing severe depression and suicidal tendencies in NRP's. NRP's have to try and provide for their families at home whilst paying out a huge 25% plus of their income to their ex partners.
attributes.additional_details: The government decide how much an adult requires to live on so people on jobseekers allowance receive the same amount from one person to the next. Why is it the more a working NRP earns the more they have to pay the other parent? Why does the child suddenly require more money because the NRP has got a better job or worked overtime. NRP's often work extra hours to try and compensate for CMS/CSA payments and then they are required to pay the other parent more because their income has increased?

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum sentence for shaken baby deaths no guilty plea reduction.
attributes.background: We are calling for a mandatory minimum sentence of 15 years when an offender kills a child through shaking the infant. This should also mean that they are not eligible for the reduction in sentence when pleading guilty to get a lower jail term.
attributes.additional_details: The case of lee sweet who pled guilty to manslaughter of his son should serve as a warning that this should never happen again.  No family should have to wait a year to lay to rest such a precious life, let alone have to watch as he received a third reduction in sentence for pleading guilty after 11 months of denining it.

attributes.action: Add age verified delivery option to Offensive Weapons Bill Section 15
attributes.background: please consider giving businesses an option to use an 'age verified delivery service' for residential addresses rather than a totally unnecessary outright ban, it will achieve the same goal but will not be as destructive to businesses, their employees and us as hobbyists

attributes.action: Introduce screening for ovarian cancer
attributes.background: Age 29 my friend and I were dignosed with ovarian cancer. I had recieved an early dignoses but my friend was turned away by A&E and her GP. A healthy size 8 and look pregnant. Due to months of misdiagnosis she was told she had stage 4 cancer. She needed a miracle.
attributes.additional_details:
Ovarian cancer is the 4th most common cancer in women and no screening A blood test CA125 could detect. Our GP's are not educated enough and are unfamiliar with the symptoms. The symptoms are misdiagnosed with IBS.
Only 15% of women are diagnosed at early stage. 
We need to make awareness! Educate GP's and A&E doctors. We need screening.
I am now 30 a single mum of a 3 year old. If If I  hadn't pushed my GP I might not of been here now. Too many ladies have been affected by this disease.

attributes.action: Make malicious, false reports or allegations to authorities a criminal offence.
attributes.background: At the moment a report or allegation which has been made maliciously with intent to harm is treated as a civil matter. The Data Protection Act allows people to make false reports wasting time and resources whilst protecting their identity. This should be treated as a criminal offence and punishable.
attributes.additional_details:
There is nothing civil about making a report to authorities about someone that is based on lies, malice and with intent to harm the accused.

Currently malicious reports are treated as a civil matter and police do not get involved. These reports can cause distress and for the person accused. The Data Protection Act protects the rights of the reporter even when a report has been investigated and proven to be malicious and false. These people get away with wasting public funds, resources.

attributes.action: Look at the stats for adopted children failing in education and reasons why
attributes.background: Having been a foster carer, now a parent of two adopted children and working in education, I have decided to speak out for all those families who live with the reality that adoption can bring for their children and education. The statistics for adopted children failing in education are unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Once a child is adopted the trauma some of them have faced does not suddenly disappear and the support they require needs to be accessible for them especially in education and I believe this starts with training for all staff in schools and nurseries. 
Failing in education due to lack of understanding of an adopted childs needs is unacceptable and I want the government to have to answer to why the statistics are so high.

attributes.action: Make it an offence for a parent to stop child contact with the other parent
attributes.background: There are many parents who use their children as weapons in disputes with their exes. Bitterness between adults should not interfere in a childs upbringing. Stopping a childs contact with the other parent because of anger is child abuse & neglect. Emotional needs are as important as physical needs.
attributes.additional_details: If there is a danger to the child them obviously this is a different scenario but children should not be stopped having contact with either parent because 'mummy is very angry with daddy' and vice versa.

attributes.action: Create a new offence of Infant Sexual Abuse with appropriate sentences
attributes.background: Infant Sexual Abuse causes lifelong complex PTSD. It manifests in physiological, neurological, mental, relational & social dysfunction in the survivor’s identity. Sexual abuse of a child aged six or under should be a separate criminal offence with similar sentences to murder.
attributes.additional_details: - everyone convicted of ISA should be given a life sentence with a minimum term set by a judge.

attributes.action: Save a sensitive heritage-defining greenfield site from industrial development.
attributes.background: We want the government to insist that MetroWest locate their proposed industrial rail construction and maintenance yard in a more appropriate location than they are currently proposing at a greenfield site at Clanage Road, Bower Ashton which will blight historic Bristol defining views.
attributes.additional_details: MetroWest are consulting in relation to the reopening of the Portishead to Bristol rail line. In connection with their proposals which are broadly welcomed they are attempting to 'steamroller' local 'soft' landowners into surrendering open green land in the middle of conservation belt and without regard for the damage that this will cause to the heritage views of the Grade 1 listed Clifton Suspension Bridge and the Grade 2 and 2* buildings which have defined Bristol for centuries.

attributes.action: Force motorway service areas (MSAs) provide security for visiting HGVs at night.
attributes.background: I am the operator of a single lorry. In two months I have had six holes cut in my trailer curtains and a braking system cable stolen while at MSAs. Parking at MSAs costs up to £34. I have been told by an operator that they don't have to do any more. Damage, load and fuel theft happens very often.
attributes.additional_details:
Returning to secure yards increases empty mileage, emissions and costs. It also increases fleet sizes and congestion. Some loads can't be delivered in one day and require overnight parking away from base.
A security guard from 20:00 to 06:00 would cost an MSA around £102, just 4 trucks per night. 
The cost of my repairs is £850 + VAT (approx) in 8 weeks, equal to a drivers wage. Increased costs for firms mean higher prices at the shops.
Visit http://ninefiftysix.co.uk/tag/petition-2018/ for more

attributes.action: Condemn the actions of the 1970-79 Governments in taking the UK into the EEC
attributes.background: There has long been controversy as to the legality of Britain being a member of the EEC/EU. We believe that our entry into the EU was contrary to the Vienna Convention 1969 and the British Bill of Rights 1689. The Government must acknowledge this and condemn the actions of the 1970-79 Governments.
attributes.additional_details: Actions that violated the Vienna Convention could include secret negotiations, misleading the people and failing to conform with the constitution of the signature state. No Treaty is valid if people of that state are misled as to the intentions of a treaty and it is not made in "good faith". With the republication of document FCO 30/1048, we believe the 1970-79 Governments were complicit when assuring the people and UK Parliament that there was no question of surrendering national sovereignty.

attributes.action: Extend Abdulla Alhindawe's UK Visa
attributes.background: Abdulla Alhindawe is a courteous young, social and friendly person. As some of you may know Abdulla was diagnosed with Lymphoma in 2017 and fought the battle and won. The NHS recommends for anyone who has been diagnosed with Lymphoma to stay in the UK for 5 years after treatment is complete.
attributes.additional_details: However Abdulla is in the UK because of his dad coming to the UK on a student visa. Abdulla was due to go back to Iraq in June 2017 but to his illness his visa was extended to April 2018, meaning Abdulla will have to leave at the start of April 2018. Where Abdulla lives in Iraq there is a 50% chance of death by bombing at any given moment. Also his visa was not extended to consider the 5 years that NHS recommends to anyone diagnosed with Lymphoma.

attributes.action: Allow Sativex for Fibromyalgia, CFS & Myalgic Encephalomyelitis
attributes.background: Allow the use of Sativex for the treatment of Fibromyalgia, CFS & M.E. Sativex is available on the NHS for MS. It can also help with the symptoms of Fibromyalgia, CFS & ME.
attributes.additional_details: There is not one specific drug that is designed for these conditions. There is little chance of finding medication to help relieve symptoms. Drugs prescribed can have damaging side effects and patients show little improvement after taking them. Sativex can relieve symptoms and should be allowed as a choice for the patient instead of opioids.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of unnecessary single use plastics in UK shops.
attributes.background: We are a Year 3 class in a school in London, We have been exploring single use plastic and it's damaging effect on oceans. After finishing our research we have decided that the government has a responsibility to limit excess use of plastics. This could be achieved by fines or tax breaks.

attributes.action: On exit of EU, enact law to require rabies titer for dogs entering without owner
attributes.background: An estimated 30,000 dogs from the EU enter the UK each year as commercial imports. In 2013 the number was 1,869. The majority of dogs are "rescue dogs", up to 50 in a van, from Romania, Bosnia, Serbia & Bulgaria. Many with falsified passports and have not been vaccinated against rabies nor wormed.
attributes.additional_details: Barnaby's Law, is a campaign named after my dog, bought in the UK & now in quarantine. We're not against re-homing from EU but diseases we eradicated or never had are on the increase. A rabies titer test result, obtained before travel, should be required for all dogs not travelling on the pet passport scheme and within 5 days of their owner. To prevent the possibility of fake titer results,chip readers should be available for use at UK BIP's and the chip number checked against the FAVN database.

attributes.action: Make sign language part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Communication should be for all. By making British sign language part of the curriculum, we would offer inclusion and equality for those using signing to support their daily communication. Learning signing would enable all children to interact despite their disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Following Down's Syndrome day and working in the early years sector my passion for this has spiked. 
We learn to communicate during our early years and language is something we hear all around us everyday to enable us to communicate effectively, yet we don't all consider teaching signing as routine to enable communication for all. Doing this would offer inclusion for those using signing daily and enable others to communicate with their peers.

attributes.action: Make 3rd party ticket sales for NFL London series Illegal, same as football.
attributes.background: With the increasing demand for tickets for the NFL international series in London, it is becoming more difficult for real fans to obtain tickets at cost. 3rd party sellers are buying up tickets and reselling for multiple times face value. This has to stop as real fans are missing out on tickets.

attributes.action: Make bereavement benefits accessible to cohabiting parents
attributes.background: Bereavement payments are designed to aid families who may have lost a significant portion of their income due to the death of a loved one. However, these payments are only accessible to the spouse or civil partner of the deceased. Children of unmarried couples are eligible for nothing.
attributes.additional_details: On the 8th of December my partner took his own life. Myself and my daughter have been left in a difficult situation and are not eligible for any bereavement support simply because we weren't married.

attributes.action: End bedroom tax for bereaved parents/carers on the room of their deceased child
attributes.background:
Bedroom tax on the room of a deceased child is unfair, no parent wants an empty room for this reason.
My daughter passed away 2.5 years ago and I haven’t unpacked her hospital bag. I couldn’t imagine being forced to pack up her belongings and move away from the home that holds our memories.
attributes.additional_details:
Bedroom tax comes into effect a year after the child’s death, if the parent is claiming housing benefit.
A year is a short period of time after the loss of a child to then endure the stress of extra financial commitments.
Some parents may feel unable to work due overwhelming grief, PTSD or other reasons. 
Penalising them for their child’s death or making them move before they are ready will only cause more distress.
It is a cruel tax placed on people who are already suffering unimaginable pain.

attributes.action: Make middle rate DLA a base rate for children with Cystic fibrosis.
attributes.background: Many parents caring for a child with Cystic fibrosis aren't getting carers allowance because families are being told they can only get lower rate disability living allowance, CF is a chronic illness that requires many daily treatments. Many parents cant work due to this & need carers allowance!
attributes.additional_details: Many people are awarded middle or high level for the care and mobility parts of DLA, its awarded for conditions that aren't chronic, so CF should be taken more seriously with awards. Some families on forums discuss how two families who have CF children with the same daily routines apply and one may be awarded lower rate and one higher rate. Theres no pattern at all it just depends who gets the paperwork. CF should have a minimum award rate of middle care.

attributes.action: Require a Register for Telecommunications to Publish EMF Radiation
attributes.background: EMF radiation in unsafe levels is a threat to public health and safety.  A public register for telecommunications to publish EMF radiation from mast towers or similar is paramount for public health and authorities to monitor under national and international laws.
attributes.additional_details: A public register for telecommunication mast towers EMF radiation levels is needed.  Other industries are expected under Environmental Law, Public Health and Health and Safety to operate within national and international standards and even to publish for controls, management, obligation and accountability.  Telecommunication companies have many of their mast towers in residential areas and do not publish public the EMF radiation levels past or present and a threat to public health.

attributes.action: We urge the Government to do more to identify PTSD in Service Veterans
attributes.background: PTSD is rapidly becoming the biggest killer of Service personnel. We need to do more to identify the condition before it takes over. Our Service personnel deserve the best after giving us so much, we cannot just throw them into a Society that doesn’t have the patience or understanding to accept them
attributes.additional_details: How many more veterans will die, feeling alone and full of guilt, self-loathing and unable to function?  It is a National disgrace that we lose these heroes every day because they are allowed to be ignored.  The first step is for the Armed Forces to counsel everyone and to provide a caring, professional solution.  This may involve the NHS even whilst these personnel are still serving.  If all three organisations work better together we can begin to understand more and provide a safer environment for them all

attributes.action: Change employee benefits/deductions calculation in relation to umbrella company
attributes.background: Change law/tax rules to ensure equal pay/benefits for agency workers using umbrella companies-paying workers less by avoiding Employers NI. ENI is deducted from workers’ wages.This petition seeks a law to prevent workers getting less take-home pay than directly employed people doing exact same job.
attributes.additional_details: There must be equal take-home pay for equal work for agency workers. Umbrella companies say that workers agree to work like this, but we know in the industry that this is not so and that workers are not given a choice and must go umbrella if they want to get employment. This is a widespread practice that is hurting the pockets of vulnerable workers.

attributes.action: Test pregnant women and newborn babies for Group B Streptococcus (GBS)
attributes.background: My newborn son was diagnosed with Sepsis at 14 days old, this is a very serious condition that can cause infant fatality in hours, loss of limbs and or the body organs to shut down, it can also cause Meningitis and other serious conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
I have researched this condition and have found that Sepsis can be brought on by babies contracting Group B Streptococcus from the mother during labour.   I would like to see changes made through the NHS to routinely test pregnant mothers for GBS in late pregnancy,  or routinely test new born infants at birth, thus identifying the deadly potential to further develop Sepsis.
Most mums, both during pregnancy and post pregnancy have never received NHS information on either of these deadly illnesses

attributes.action: Require supermarkets to offer a plastic-free option for all their fruit & veg.
attributes.background: In response to the problem of an ever-increasing amount of plastic waste polluting our environment, we need to make supermarkets offer an option of no packaging or eco-friendly packaging for each item of fresh fruit and vegetables they sell.
attributes.additional_details: Currently there is evidence of an intolerable level of plastic loose in the ocean. In order to back up the work being done to reduce this waste, it is necessary to reduce our use of packaging in an individual level, and among the most difficult to avoid is the packaging of fresh fruit and vegetables in supermarkets. Forcing supermarkets to provide us with the choice of buying cucumbers, cabbages, broccoli etc in eco-friendly packaging will enable people on their journey to zero waste.

attributes.action: Reverse changes to the Direct Schools Grant
attributes.background:
Changes to the Direct Schools Grant mean that local authorities are required to "pass through" 93-95% of funding to external providers. 
The Government set aside £55m in transitional funding, but councils cannot access this for their nurseries.
Public sector nurseries nationwide now face closure.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year, Salford City Council invests £1.5m into its five nurseries. The nurseries are open to all, but specialise in supporting children and families with additional needs. They are all rated outstanding by Ofsted and score better than the city's private sector provision in school-readiness. They have a low turnover of highly dedicated and well-trained staff.

Changes to the Direct Schools Grant mean those nurseries are threatened with closure. 

The problem is replicated across the country.

attributes.action: Equality for gay men giving blood
attributes.background: I was going to join the blood donation club today. I was feeling rather heroic knowing my blood would be used to help save lives. Because I am a gay man in a four-year relationship, I was told that I wouldn’t be eligible to donate.
attributes.additional_details: I have to stay celibate for a minimum of 3 months in order to qualify.

attributes.action: Make June 23 Independence Day! The day we voted for sovereignty and independence
attributes.background:
Two years ago we voted to Leave the EU.
We voted to take back control of our sovereignty and independence.
To mark that historic day, Britain should mark June 23 as Independence Day every year.

attributes.action: Ban Releases Of Foil & Plastic Balloons, Balloons With Ribbons & Sky Lanterns
attributes.background: We are the National Association Of Balloon Artists & Suppliers (NABAS), and we are seriously concerned that the release of Foil Balloons, Plastic Balloons, Any Balloons With Ribbons Attached And Sky Lanterns represent a genuine threat to wildlife and our environment and therefore should be banned.
attributes.additional_details: There are far to many examples of the damaging effect caused by irresponsible release of foil balloons, plastic balloons and indeed any balloon with ribbons or plastic attached. Sky lanterns pose an additional risk as a fire hazard and a risk to our animals and wildlife due to the wire framed or bamboo construction, and they create a choking hazard. We respect the findings of the 2013 DEFRA report, but evidence shows a ban on such releases is needed. Our request does not include latex balloons

attributes.action: Scrap the expansion plans for Heathrow Airport
attributes.background: More expansion for London, which the residents don't want. More pollution, years of misery on the M25, and wasting taxpayer money in an outdated hub-and-spoke airport operating model. The rest of the UK would love the chance to expand their infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details: East Midlands Airport in Leicestershire is the absolute logical choice for expanding the UK's network. It's got a HUGE runway (already handles 747s, A380s and An-124s), it's right next to the M42 (for M6) and M1, and it's on the route of HS2. If it has to be in London, then Gatwick is by far a more sensible option when you consider disruption, pollution, and cost.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for cycle races/time trials to race on open, public ways/roads.
attributes.background:
Cycle racing/time trials on open/public roads need to be reviewed. Cycles are getting faster, meaning more danger to other road users, pedestrians etc and roads are getting busier with more cars than ever.

Cycle races/time trials should now only be held on closed ways/roads.
attributes.additional_details:
"A person who promotes or takes part in a race or trial of speed between motor vehicles on a public way is guilty of an offence."

This should include cyclists. Cycles are faster and more streamlined than they have ever been for general road use, so races/time trials on public ways are faster than they have ever been and therefore more dangerous an should be illegal. A cycle can go faster than a 50cc moped but it is illegal to race a moped, but not a cycle.

This needs seriously reviewing.

attributes.action: Exempt the use of a knife from self-defence and reasonable force.
attributes.background: When someone stabs another unarmed person who is not carrying a knife, they should not be able to claim self-defence. For example, when someone is punched and they respond by stabbing the other to death with a knife.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone that goes out on the streets in a public place carrying a knife, should not be allowed to claim they used the knife in self-defence whether someone punches them or shouts at them or throws something at them. 

People are being acquitted even when the other person is unarmed and not carrying a knife. 

The law needs to change. If you go out with a knife it should be presumed that you do so with the intention to use it. No-one should be allowed to say they carry for protection.

attributes.action: The NHS should give boys the HPV vaccine to prevent cancers later in life.
attributes.background: Boys will suffer from HPV related cancers later in life just as girls will if they aren’t given the HPV vaccine. Currently it is said to be cheaper to treat the cancers than to provide the vaccine. These are some of the few preventable cancers; lets act on this one!

attributes.action: Make Fake Social Media Profiles Illegal
attributes.background: Fake profiles are used on Facebook, Instagram, dating websites and more. These profiles are currently used to abuse, stalk, harass, shame or harm real people emotionally and in some cases physically. People use these fake identities to disguise their own so they can get away with harmful behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: If fake profiles were made illegal there would be more discouragement to make one in the first place as the repercussions would be higher. I have personally been stalked, harassed, body shamed, and received vulgar bullying messages from one individual posing as multiple. There are enough public circumstances that have lead to physical attacks, assaults and self harm. Positive action needs to be made to prevent fake profiles as this should be considered criminal fraudulent activity. Thank You

attributes.action: UK to refer Sri Lanka to ICC in March 2019
attributes.background: Refer Sri Lanka to International Criminal Court, if it continues to fail to implement its commitment made to the UNHRC Res. [A/HRC/RES/30/1] by March 2019; by agreeing to provide accountability and transitional justice.
attributes.additional_details: It has failed to implement the resolution and brazenly repudiated its commitments to the UNHRC and victims of the war, so far without consequence. In March 2018 UN Human Rights Commissioner Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein has also explicitly expressed his frustration, having lost faith in Sri Lanka’s willingness to engineer transitional justice and has called on member states to “explore other avenues, including the application of universal jurisdiction,that could foster accountability.” the UN Deputy for Human Rights, Kate Gilmore called for the establishment of a Special Court.

attributes.action: We call on Goverment to provide an extra £10M a year for Leicestershire Police.
attributes.background:
We call on the Home Secretary to provide an extra £10 million a year for overstretched Leicestershire Police.
It would provide 300 extra officers on the beat to fight increasing crime including shop lifting, burglaries & knife-crime.With fewer officers, the force is struggling to deal with crime.
attributes.additional_details:
There are more reported burglaries, instances of shoplifting, people dealing drugs and in some instances children as young as 12 are apparently selling drugs.
Unless something is done and soon, problems will only escalate. Resources are limited across the public sector but it is false economy not to deal with the situation.
People must be able to feel safe in their own homes, and city.
We are hoping that if enough people support the petition the issue will be debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: Make all nappies and baby wipes sold in the UK 100% biodegradable by 2020
attributes.background: 8 million disposable nappies are dumped each day in the UK and will be on earth 5 times longer than the babies that used them. Making all disposable nappies & wipes biodegradable would reduce their environmental impact & increase parental access to less damaging products. #HelpUsLiveGreener
attributes.additional_details:
The public cannot begin to contribute to the repair of the environment & pollution problems when they are confronted with plastic in all their purchases. The government must demand manufacturers improve or pay damages. We have the science, just not the policy

Veolia nappy data: https://www.veolia.co.uk/westberkshire/waste-minimisation/waste-minimisation/real-nappies-facts
Nappies in the environment: https://web.whoi.edu/seagrant/wp-content/uploads/sites/24/2015/04/Marine-Debris-Poster_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Scrap the £500 deposit to run for parliament
attributes.background: The deposit is unreasonable as it depends on financial means. The ability to pay a specified fee is not a relevant or appropriate criterion for determining access to the ballot paper. There should never be an ‘entrance fee’ to democracy, the democratic process should be open to all.
attributes.additional_details:
The deposit of £500 is returned if the candidate gets 5% of the vote - with low turnouts at elections due to voter apathy , this is a tall order for the minor parties and independents. This in turn puts those candidates in a position where they are forced to consider finances before partaking in the democratic right to stand for election . 
Lost deposits go to the Treasury's Consolidated Fund, which is effectively the government's current account-that’s why I call it a ‘Tax on Democracy'.

attributes.action: Make first aid&basic life support a legal requirement for junior school children
attributes.background: A large percentage of accidents and emergencies occur in a household. The vast majority of these incidents that occur have a child present on scene. Many of these children present have no understanding and practical knowledge of basic first aid which could be pivotal in saving a life or limb.
attributes.additional_details: The aim of this scheme is to introduce and educate children in junior year groups 5 and 6 how to manage minor injuries such as burns and lacerations. Also covered within these workshops, children will learn how to recognise when someone is in cardiac arrest and how to perform BASIC life support until suitable help arrives.

attributes.action: Provide around-the-clock care and a 24/7 helpline for traumatised troops
attributes.background:
The Mail on Sunday is campaigning to ensure our brave soldiers no longer suffer in silence.
Our 'Helpline for Heroes' campaign calls on defence chiefs to set up a 24/7 helpline staffed by mental healthcare experts. It would cost just £2million.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1995, more than 400 serving UK troops have killed themselves while the number of personnel suffering from Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) has almost doubled since 2007 to 2,500 cases.
Yet, shockingly, the Government has cut back the provision of mental healthcare to the Armed Forces. Today, traumatised troops must rely on the NHS and charities for help outside office hours and at weekends.

attributes.action: Extend the 10-year storage limit on egg freezing
attributes.background: In the UK, the HFE Act states that all gametes can be stored for up to 10 years, but for medical egg storage and for sperm storage it can be extended to 55 years. Currently, eggs frozen for social reasons cannot be extended for more than the initial 10-year period; it is this we wish to change.
attributes.additional_details: Research examining social egg freezing have most commonly identified the lack of a suitable partner, a fear of running out of time to form the desired family, and a fear of future regret as driving women’s use of this technology (Baldwin, 2018; Baldwin et al 2018; Waldby, 2015). In order to allow women to have sufficient time to use their stored eggs to conceive the 10 year time limit needs to be removed.

attributes.action: Investigate Southeastern’s handling of the Lewisham situation on 2/3/2018
attributes.background: On 2/3/2018 hundreds of passengers boarded the 16:35 from London Bridge to Dartford. The train in front broke down due to age (as admitted by the driver). Passengers forced to wait for 4 hours in freezing conditions and no toilet/food/heat/information. Why was this handled so badly?
attributes.additional_details: We want a full investigation into what happened and someone to be held accountable for this mess so that it is not allowed to happen again. Please immediately initiate a government inquest and find out what Southeastern started doing the moment they learned what had happened, why it took so long to initiate a rescue plan and why they were nowhere to be seen for the entire duration of the event. The concern is that this could have been so much worse and that they were just lucky this time.

attributes.action: National Minimum Wage for SIA License Holders at 40% above Normal Minimum Wage
attributes.background: With Minimum Wage rising and coming in line with Security Organisations pay rate, the government should protect License Holders and impose a 40% raise above the National Minimum Wage. Minimum Wage is currently at £7.83, with a 40% increase License Holders would receive £10.96 minimum an hour.
attributes.additional_details: Many companies have failed to raise the wages of Security Officers due to profit constraints in security servicing contracts. The government should role out a mandatory 40% increase against minimum wage in which the contractor must pay its License Holders once contracts have been renewed or at the next available opportunity. The 40% increase should then be processed at each Minimum Wage rise to maintain a competitive pay industry.

attributes.action: Ban processed meat adverts in the UK
attributes.background: Processed meat has been classified as carcinogenic to humans by the WHO. As little as one serving a day increases the risk of diabetes by 50% and heart disease by 42% (guardian) and causes 8,500 cancers every year. Advertisements of it should be banned completely.
attributes.additional_details:
Processed meat was now in a group of 120 proven carcinogens, alongside alcohol, asbestos and tobacco.
The WHO advised that consuming 50g of processed meat a day – equivalent to just a couple of rashers of bacon or one hotdog – would raise the risk of getting bowel cancer by 18% over a lifetime. The consumption of processed meat causes an additional 34,000 worldwide cancer deaths a year,  four times the number of people killed annually on Britain’s roads.
Consuming just 9g of bacon a day – less than a rasher – could significantly raise the risk of developing breast cancer later in life. Jill Pell from Glasgow University says that “it would be misleading” for health authorities to set any safe dose for processed meat “other than zero”. The Guardian.

attributes.action: Require teacher training about how to educate children with FASD
attributes.background: I have a child with fetal alcohol spectrum disorder (FASD) and alcohol-related neurodevelopmental disorder (ARND). Teachers need training to educate the thousands of children with this condition. So many of them are being failed because of the lack of awareness within our schools and society.
attributes.additional_details: FASD is a condition a lot of children are born with due to the consumption of alcohol in pregnancy. The condition can range from very mild to very extreme. Children with this condition find their everyday lives very hard ranging from: forming friendships; understanding emotions; having delayed speech; poor short term memory; anger issues; and finding it very hard in education. There are a few organisations out there that offer a lot of advice like NOFAS-UK which help educate people school and other professionals.

attributes.action: Reimburse the NHS from foreign aid budget 4 treatment given to foreign nationals
attributes.background:
Health tourism is costing the already strained NHS millions of pounds.
The NHS should be given a reimbursement from the foreign aid budget for any unrecovered costs of treatment of foreign nationals.

attributes.action: Expel Israeli Ambassador, after attacks on the State of Palestine.
attributes.background: Demonstrations by Palestinians against Trump's declaration of Jerusalem as capital of Israel were met with violence by Israeli soldiers who shot and killed demonstrators and arrested children.

attributes.action: Give free 3 rounds of IVF on the NHS to anyone under 40 that needs help
attributes.background: Going through fertility treatment is hard enough it puts a strain on your mental health & on your relationship. So as you can imagine having to fight to get IVF treatment on the NHS is an added unnecessary stress.
attributes.additional_details:
Because my partner has a child from a past relationship I’m penalised for it even tho it’s me that has the problem. I know a lot of women will be in the same situation with no where to turn so I want to change this stupid law.

The NICE guidelines state that women under 40 should be entitled to free 3 rounds of IVF yet the CCG have the final say where the majority only offer 1 round free. 

Let’s stop this postcode lottery
Let’s get the law changed
Let’s stop unnecessary suffering 
Let’s not forget Equal rights
Let’s make a change

attributes.action: Less burden of proof for post war commonwealth citizens seeking  naturalisation
attributes.background: Commonwealth citizens who were invited to relocate during the UK's recruitment drive are now in their retirement years facing deportation. They entered the UK legally to help build post war Britain & have paid taxes in the UK. They are now discovering naturalisation was necessary but never happened.
attributes.additional_details: The 1971 Immigration Act gave people already settled in Britain Indefinite leave to Remain. These children are now adults and most are struggling to gather enough documents to convince the Home Office that they arrived before the cut off point. Some are being taken to Immigration Removal Centres, refused cancer treatment, becoming homeless and dismissed from their place of work as well as being refused any recourse to public funds which they have paid into for the past 50 plus years.

attributes.action: Take no military action in Syria using UK forces or weapons.
attributes.background: The cost of such action cannot be justified if public money is not currently  available to support vital health, social welfare, policing, ambulance, education and local authority services in our country.
